message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

The paper focuses on conditional recurrent language modelling, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the cs.CL (Computation and Language) category. The paper also discusses the use of deep neural networks, which is a common topic in the cs.LG (Machine Learning) category. The proposed decoding strategy is motivated by the observation of nonlinear hidden layers, which is related to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) category. The paper also evaluates the proposed strategy on neural machine translation, which is a task commonly studied in the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) category. Finally, the paper mentions applications such as image and video description generation, which are related to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) category.
